subject: Re: [junit] Message texts
msgSnippet: ... Interesting. I read it the opposite way: Joe unexpectedly has a name. In other words, the test fails /because/ Joe has a name. -- J. B. Rainsberger,
messageBody:
Sven Gorts wrote:

> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Joe has a name
> at SomeTest.test(SomeTest.java:10)
>
> Which I read as:
> The assertion stating that Joe has a name failed

Interesting. I read it the opposite way:

"Joe unexpectedly has a name."

In other words, the test fails /because/ Joe has a name.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
